intro: Seseli andronakii, commonly known as the Andronakii seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus, particularly in Georgia and Turkey. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stem and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a finely toothed margin, and it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
